title: SimpleKeys 2.2.6 with sn
description:
For those of you that don't use Drop Drawers.app, and your dock is over-crowded - this app is for you!

Official Web Site:  <a href=" http://www.pidog.com/SimpleKeys/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.pidog.com/SimpleKeys/</a>

SimpleKeys 2 is a complete rewrite of the popular f-key shortcut program. Now in addition to programing your function keys, SimpleKeys allows you to:

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Execute an action with any key combination

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Now types as fast as the recieving application can accept keystrokes

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Create Macros by combining multiple actions under a single KeyStroke

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Import and Export Settings

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Supports drag and drop of shortcuts to and from the items list. This allows you to email a shortcut to a friend, or save it for later.

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Execute AppleScripts on the files selected in the finder or using the text on the clipboard.

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Supports all special accented characters.

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Type text, including the date, the text on the clipboard, and any KeyCombo (ie. Apple-S to save a file)

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Paste text, including the date.

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Pause to wait for events to complete.

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Launch a file with the default application, or with a specific application.

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Open a URL in your default web browser.

System Requirements:

OS X.4.11 and above

Manual is included (but IMHO - not very useful) as a .rtf file
